channel.title: CSS Functions :: CIS 526 Textbook
channel.description: CSS provides a number of useful functions that calculate values. Functions are written in the form name(arg1, arg2, ...) and are provided as values to CSS properties. For example, this CSS code sets the height of the content area to the available space on screen for content after subtracting a header and footer: #header {height: 150px} #footer {height: 100px} #content { height: calc(100vh - 150px - 100px); } Here 100vh is the height of the viewport, and the header and footer are defined in terms of pixels.
